definition: to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute

sentences.english: In such an atmosphere of mistrust, miscalculation rules on both sides.
sentences.chinese: 在如此互不信任的氛圍下，雙方都有失算。

sentences.english: Raise your financial estimates, twice. Then miss them, twice.
sentences.chinese: 兩次上調財務預測，然後兩次失算。
可是，敵人大大的失算了。

sentences.english: Clothing is a script for a woman to record her countless achievements and mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 衣服，是一個女人無數的計算與失算的劇本。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate errors and mechanism of acalculia in patients with brain injury.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討腦損傷患者失算症的錯誤表現和相關腦機制。

definition: God's plans supersede our own/Man proposes but God disposes
pinyin: ren2 suan4 bu4 ru2 tian1 suan4

definition: to fall into a trap/taken in by a stratagem/cheated/ripped off
to meet with unexpected failure (idiom)/to fail miserably (where failure was not expected)
to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
to play tricks on/to make a fool of
to reckon/to calculate/to plan/to expect/to scheme
see 偷雞不成蝕把米|偷鸡不成蚀把米[tou1 ji1 bu4 cheng2 shi2 ba3 mi3]
pinyin: tou1 ji1 bu4 zhao2 shi2 ba3 mi3

definition: to succeed by a lucky stroke
lit. to try to steal a chicken only to end up losing the rice used to lure it (idiom)/fig. to try to gain an advantage only to end up worse off/to go for wool and come back shorn
pinyin: tou1 ji1 bu4 cheng2 shi2 ba3 mi3

definition: to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
predictable/sth one can predict without being a clairvoyant
grasp it and victory is assured/to have success within one's grasp (idiom)
